text: The 1962–63 Yorkshire Football League was the 37th season in the history of the Yorkshire Football League, a football competition in England. ==Division One== Division One featured 12 clubs which competed in the previous season, along with four new clubs, promoted from Division Two: *Bridlington Trinity *Doncaster United *Hatfield Main *Swallownest Miners Welfare ===League table=== ===Map=== ==Division Two== Division Two featured ten clubs which competed in the previous season, along with five new clubs. *Clubs relegated from Division One: **Frickley Colliery reserves **Ossett Town **Swillington Miners Welfare *Plus: **Dodworth Miners Welfare **Mexborough Town, new club Also, Brodsworth Main Colliery changed name to Brodsworth Main. ===League table=== ===Map=== ==References== Category:1962–63 in English football leagues Category:Yorkshire Football League
title: 1962–63 Yorkshire Football League
